str2: Master, teacher, chief, commander. From epi and a presumed derivative of histemi; an appointee over, i.e. Commander.
Simon. Of Hebrew origin; Simon, the name of nine Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From a derivative of kopos; to feel fatigue; by implication, to work hard.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The night, night-time. A primary word; 'night'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From rheo; an utterance, ; by implication, a matter or topic; with a negative naught whatever.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To let down, lower, slacken, loosen. From the base of chasma; to lower.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A fishing-net. Probably from a primary verb diko; a seine.
